title: Asking about a long bus trip
context: Ask the driver when the bus will make a designated rest stop.

neutral.text: How long until the next stop?
When do we stop for a break?
Are we close to a rest stop?
How much longer until we stop?
Can you tell me when we'll stop?
How soon will we arrive at a rest stop?

informal.text: When do we get a break?
Are we almost at a rest stop?
When's the next time we can get off?
How soon can we stretch our legs?
Can you let me know when we'll stop next?

formal.text: Could you inform me of the next scheduled stop?
When might we expect to arrive at a rest stop?
I would appreciate knowing when the next stop will be.
Could you please tell me when we will be stopping next?
When is the next designated rest stop?
I would like to know the estimated time of our next stop.

patterns.meaning: Asking about the next stop for a specific purpose
Asking about the duration until the next stop or arrival

dialogs.description: Passenger asking the driver about the next rest stop

lines.speaker: Passenger
lines.text: Excuse me, when's the next rest stop?

lines.speaker: Driver
lines.text: We'll be stopping in about an hour at a rest stop.

dialogs.description: Passenger inquiring about the next stop to stretch their legs

lines.speaker: Passenger
lines.text: Hey, how much longer 'til we stop?

lines.speaker: Driver
lines.text: We've got about 30 minutes until our next stop. You can stretch your legs then.
